glsa.title: Openfire: Denial of Service
glsa.synopsis: A design error in Openfire might lead to a Denial of Service.

background.p: Openfire (formerly Wildfire) is a Java implementation of a complete Jabber server.

description.p: Openfire's connection manager in the file ConnectionManagerImpl.java cannot handle clients that fail to read messages, and has no limit on their session's send buffer.

impact.p: Remote authenticated attackers could trigger large outgoing queues without reading messages, causing a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Openfire users should upgrade to the latest version:
